pose_description: Tree Pose is a balancing posture that strengthens the legs, ankles, and feet while improving flexibility and balance.
pose_benefits: Strengthens the legs, ankles, and feet. Improves flexibility in the hips and knees. Improves balance.
instructions: Start standing tall with feet together.
Shift weight onto one foot.
Place the sole of the other foot on the inner thigh.
Press hands together in prayer position at chest.
Raise arms overhead with palms touching.
Keep gaze forward and hold.

pose_description: Warrior One Pose is a standing posture that stretches the chest, lungs, and shoulders while strengthening the legs, back, and arms.
pose_benefits: Stretches the chest, lungs, shoulders, neck, belly and groin (psoas). Strengthens the shoulders, arms and back muscles. Strengthens and stretches the thighs, calves and ankles.
instructions: Start in a wide stance, feet aligned.
Turn back foot 60 degrees forward.
Bend front knee 90 degrees over ankle.
Square hips forward.
Raise arms overhead, palms facing each other.
Lift ribcage and tuck pelvis.
Gaze forward and hold.

pose_description: Warrior Two Pose is a standing posture that strengthens and stretches the legs, groin, and chest while improving stamina and focus.
pose_benefits: Strengthens and stretches the legs and ankles. Stretches the groin, chest, lungs, and shoulders. Stimulates abdominal organs. Increases stamina. Relieves backaches, especially through the second trimester of pregnancy. Therapeutic for carpal tunnel syndrome, flat feet, infertility, osteoporosis, and sciatica.
instructions: Start in a wide stance, feet aligned.
Turn back foot 60 degrees forward.
Bend front knee 90 degrees over ankle.
Extend arms out to sides, shoulder height.
Rotate thighs outward.
Tuck pelvis and lift ribcage.
Gaze over front fingers and hold.

pose_description: Chair Pose is a strengthening posture that works the lower body, core, and upper body while improving stamina and focus.
pose_benefits: Strengthens the ankles, thighs, calves, and spine. Stretches shoulders and chest. Stimulates the abdominal organs, diaphragm, and heart. Reduces flat feet. Energizes the entire body.
instructions: Start standing with feet together.
Lift toes and root feet into the earth.
Bend knees, weight on heels.
Tuck pelvis and lift ribcage.
Raise arms overhead, biceps by ears.
Gaze forward and hold.

pose_description: Mountain Pose is a foundational posture that improves posture and balance while strengthening the legs and core.
pose_benefits: Improves posture and balance. Strengthens thighs, knees, and ankles. Firms abdomen and buttocks. Relieves sciatica.
instructions: Stand with feet together, big toes touching.
Distribute weight evenly on both feet.
Lift thighs, keep pelvis neutral.
Relax shoulders, arms at sides.
Lift chest and gaze forward.
Hold the position.

pose_description: Goddess Pose is a strengthening posture that targets the lower body, core, and upper body while improving balance and focus.
pose_benefits: Strengthens the legs, glutes, core, and upper body. Stretches the hips, chest, and shoulders. Improves balance and focus.
instructions: Stand with feet wide apart, toes outward.
Bend knees to 90 degrees, thighs parallel.
Keep pelvis neutral and chest lifted.
Bend elbows, forearms parallel to ground.
Place palms forward or in prayer position.
Gaze forward and hold.
